==Events==
*[[522 BC]] &ndash; [[Darius I of Persia]] kills the Magian usurper [[Smerdis of Persia|Gaumâta]], securing his hold as king of the [[Achaemenid Empire|Persian Empire]].
*[[480 BC]] &ndash; [[Battle of Salamis]]: The Greek fleet under [[Themistocles]] defeats the Persian fleet under [[Xerxes I]].
*[[61 BC]] &ndash; [[Pompey|Pompey the Great]] celebrates his third [[Roman triumph|triumph]] for victories over the [[pirate]]s and the end of the [[Mithridatic Wars]] on his 45th birthday.
*[[1227]] &ndash; [[Frederick II, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick II]], [[Holy Roman Emperor]], is [[excommunication|excommunicated]] by [[Pope Gregory IX]] for his failure to participate in the [[Crusades]].
*[[1364]] &ndash; [[Battle of Auray]]: [[England|English]] forces defeat the [[France|French]] in [[Brittany]]; end of the [[Breton War of Succession]].
*[[1567]] &ndash; At a dinner, the [[Fernando Álvarez de Toledo, Duke of Alba|Duke of Alba]] arrests the [[Count of Egmont]] and the [[Philip de Montmorency, Count of Hoorn|Count of Hoorn]] for [[treason]].
*[[1650]] &ndash; [[Henry Robinson (writer)|Henry Robinson]] opens his ''Office of Addresses and Encounters'' in [[Threadneedle Street]], [[London]].
*[[1717]] &ndash; An [[1717 Guatemala earthquake|earthquake]] strikes [[Antigua Guatemala]], destroying much of the city's architecture and making authorities consider moving the capital to a different city.
*[[1789]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of War]] first establishes a regular [[United States Army|army]] with a strength of several hundred men.
*  1789   &ndash; The [[1st United States Congress]] adjourns.
*[[1829]] &ndash; The [[Metropolitan Police Service|Metropolitan Police]] of [[Greater London|London]], later also known as ''the Met'', is founded.
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Battle of Pákozd]]: stalemate between [[Hungary|Hungarian]] and [[Croatia]]n forces at [[Pákozd]]; the first battle of the [[Hungarian Revolution of 1848]].
*[[1850]] &ndash; The [[Roman Catholic]] hierarchy is re-established in [[England]] and [[Wales]] by [[Pope Pius IX]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Battle of Chaffin's Farm]] is fought.
*[[1885]] &ndash; The first [[Blackpool tramway|practical public electric]] [[tram]]way in the world is opened in [[Blackpool]], [[England]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; The cornerstone is laid at [[Washington National Cathedral]] in the [[United States|U.S.]] capital.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Italy]] declares [[Italo-Turkish War|war]] on the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[World War I]], [[Battle of St. Quentin Canal]]: The [[Hindenburg Line]] is broken by [[Allies of World War I|Allied]] forces. [[Bulgaria]] signs an [[armistice]].
*[[1923]] &ndash; The [[British Mandate for Palestine (legal instrument)|British Mandate for Palestine]] takes effect, creating [[Mandatory Palestine]].
*[[1932]] &ndash; [[Chaco War]]: Last day of the [[Battle of Boquerón]] between [[Paraguay]] and [[Bolivia]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Munich Agreement]]: Germany is given permission from France, Italy, and Great Britain to seize the territory of [[Sudetenland]], Czechoslovakia.  The meeting takes place in Munich, and leaders from neither the Soviet Union nor Czechoslovakia attend.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] in [[Kiev]], [[Soviet Union]]: [[Germany|German]] [[Einsatzgruppe]] C begins the [[Babyn Yar|Babi Yar]] massacre, according to the [[Einsatzgruppen]] operational situation report.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Communist Party of China]] writes the Common Programme for the future [[People's Republic of China]].
*[[1951]] &ndash; The first live sporting event seen coast-to-coast in the [[United States]], a college [[American football|football]] game between [[Duke University|Duke]] and the [[University of Pittsburgh]], is televised on [[NBC]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; The convention establishing [[CERN]] (the European Organization for Nuclear Research) is signed.
*[[1957]] &ndash; 20 MCi (740 [[petabecquerel]]s) of radioactive material is [[Kyshtym disaster|released]] in an explosion at the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[Mayak]] nuclear plant at [[Chelyabinsk]].
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Nikita Khrushchev]], leader of [[Soviet Union]], disrupts a meeting of the [[United Nations General Assembly]] with a number of angry outbursts.
*[[1962]] &ndash; ''[[Alouette 1]],'' the first [[Canada|Canadian]] [[satellite]], is launched.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The second period of the [[Second Vatican Council]] opens.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Argentina|Argentine]] comic strip [[Mafalda]] is published for the first time.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Chevrolet Camaro]], originally named Panther, is introduced.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Oman]] joins the [[Arab League]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Sino-Japanese relations]]: [[Japan]] establishes [[diplomatic relations]] with the [[People's Republic of China]] after breaking official ties with the [[Republic of China]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[WGPR]] in Detroit, Michigan, becomes the world's first black-owned-and-operated television station.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] becomes the first pope to visit [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; The [[1982 Chicago Tylenol murders]] begin when the first of seven individuals dies in metropolitan Chicago.
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle]]: [[NASA]] launches [[STS-26]], the return to flight mission, after the [[Space Shuttle Challenger disaster|Space Shuttle ''Challenger'' disaster]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Washington National Cathedral]] is completed.
*  1990 &ndash; The YF-22, which would later become the [[F-22 Raptor]], flies for the first time.
*[[1991]] &ndash; Military coup in [[Haiti]] ([[1991 Haitian coup d'état]]).
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[President of Brazil|Brazilian President]] [[Fernando Collor de Mello]] is [[impeachment|impeached]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[United States Navy]] disbands Fighter Squadron 84 ([[VF-84]]), nicknamed the "Jolly Rogers".
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[asteroid]] [[4179 Toutatis]] passes within four lunar distances of [[Earth]].
*  2004 &ndash; The [[Burt Rutan]] [[Ansari X Prize]] entry ''[[SpaceShipOne]]'' performs a successful spaceflight, the first of two required to win the prize.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907]] collides in mid-air with an [[Embraer Legacy]] business jet near [[Peixoto de Azevedo]], [[Mato Grosso]], [[Brazil]], killing 154 total people, and triggering a [[2006–2007 Brazilian aviation crisis|Brazilian aviation crisis]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Sellafield|Calder Hall]], the world's first commercial nuclear power station, is demolished in a controlled explosion.
*[[2008]] &ndash; Following the [[bankruptcy|bankruptcies]] of [[Lehman Brothers]] and [[Washington Mutual]], The [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]] falls 777.68 points, the largest single-day point loss in its history.
*[[2009]] &ndash; An [[2009 Samoa earthquake|8.0 magnitude earthquake]] near the [[Samoan Islands]] causes a [[tsunami]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; Over 42 people are [[Gujba college massacre|killed]] by members of [[Boko Haram]] at the College of Agriculture in [[Gujba]], [[Nigeria]].
